item.title: Street have not been swept or cleaned in months, 10th October
item.description:
The pavement along Woolwich Road has not been cleaned for an extended period. As a result, there is a visible buildup of dirt, litter, and debris. In some areas, leaves and mud have accumulated, creating a slippery and unsightly surface. This is a continuous issue and regular cleaning is required. Please arrange weekly cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Station Road, Longlands, Sidcup, London

item.title: Light from crack in curb, 10th October
item.description:
There is a hole in the curb and the depth behind is unknown. It is possibly deep. An electrical light shines through the hole. It stems from a subterranean cavity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Holly Mount, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On east side just north on Greencroft Gardens, 10th October
item.description:
This gully is blocked internally. I’ve reported it many times. I don’t know why you have not sorted it out. Why has no action been taken?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priory Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is on during daylight hours., 10th October
item.description:
Street light located in Machell Road at junction with Howbury Road, lamp number 07 standing by the side wall of no.39 Howbury Road, appears wrongly calibrated as it is switched on during daylight hours when other street lights are not switched on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Machell Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bottom of Frognal on north side by Pizza restaurant, 10th October
item.description:
I’ve reported this completely blocked gully many times. Does it get unblocked and then gets blocked up again? If so why? Is a more in-depth investigation required?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Frognal, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped rubbish bags, 10th October
item.description:
These look like the bags council street cleaners leave but they've now been in this spot for 2 weeks. Frustrating as it's a usual fly tipping spot and now it seems even the council has started leaving rubbish there longer term.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roydene Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 10th October
item.description:
On Allerton Road opposite 75, this Toyota Avensis has not moved for weeks and has a parking ticket. Please remove. Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Allerton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road unswept. Grass uncut., 10th October
item.description:
The rear of the above properties has not been swept or gutter cleaned. The grass patch is overgrown. It houses a salt bin and has become a dog dog litter area. I removed half a bag of rubbish from there.Please would you resolve and if possible put up a dog fowling notice. Kindest regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gardiner Close, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights turning on too late after 7.15, 10th October
